item.title: Chants of 'intifada' ring out from pro-Palestinian protests. But what's it mean?
item.description: Chants calling for “intifada” have been a prominent feature of pro-Palestinian student protests. It’s a charged word whose use is perceived differently by people with opposing views of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

item.title: In Gaza, months of war have left Palestinians with barely the necessities to survive
item.description: Housing, medical care, schools, water and electricity are all in short supply in Gaza, which has endured a nearly eight-month siege by Israeli forces.

item.title: Vermont becomes 1st state to require oil companies to pay for climate change damages
item.description: The state's Republican governor allowed the bill to become law without his signature. The move comes after the state suffered catastrophic summer flooding and damage from other extreme weather.

item.title: The Florida deputy who shot U.S. airman Roger Fortson has been fired
item.description: On Friday, the Okaloosa County, Fla., Sheriff’s Department said that Deputy Eddie Duran was fired following the completion of an administrative internal affairs investigation amid Fortson’s death.

item.title: Publisher of ‘2,000 Mules’ election conspiracy theory film issues apology
item.description: Salem Media distributed “2,000 Mules,” which claimed Democrats conspired to steal the 2020 election. Now the company has apologized and will halt any future distribution of the film.
